intro: Habenaria andamanica, commonly known as the Andaman orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to the Andaman Islands. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces delicate, greenish-yellow flowers with a distinctive lip that is often marked with purple or red streaks. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
